questiontext.text:
A machine emits a short pulse of sound, with constant intensity over a duration of 40 ms and an amplitude of 11dB. Estimate the highest possible frequency emitted within the pulse (to the nearest 2 d.p.):

Frequency: {1:NUMERICAL:=25:0.01#You got it!~%100%50:0.01#You got it!~%100%12.5:0.01#You got it!} Hz

generalfeedback.text: The width of the Fourier spectrum is approximately equal to the reciprocal of the pulse duration, i.e. about 1/40 = 25 Hz.
